org.pikater.web.vaadin

Class CustomConfiguredUI.AppServlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • com.vaadin.server.VaadinServlet
          • org.pikater.web.vaadin.CustomConfiguredUIServlet
            • org.pikater.web.vaadin.CustomConfiguredUI.AppServlet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.vaadin.server.Constants, com.vaadin.server.SessionDestroyListener, com.vaadin.server.SessionInitListener, java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig
    Enclosing class:
    CustomConfiguredUI

    @WebServlet(value={"/*","/VAADIN/*"},
            asyncSupported=true)
public static class CustomConfiguredUI.AppServlet
extends CustomConfiguredUIServlet
    A single servlet to serve all content of this application, whether static or dynamic.

    This means that as long as all used UIs inherit from CustomConfiguredUI, the following rules take place:
    • everything is taken care of and you need not bother defining your own servlets,
    • if you add new UIs, you still have to create a URL mapping for them in CustomConfiguredUIServlet.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
